skill.name: create-plan
skill.description: Create a concise plan. Use when a user explicitly asks for a plan related to a coding task.
skill.summary: Create a concise plan. Use when a user explicitly asks for a plan related to a coding task.
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file modifications exist. Static findings are false positives triggered by metadata fields (GitHub URLs, 'command' substring in content_hash, 'md' substrings in documentation). Pure read-only prompt template.

content.value_statement: Creating detailed implementation plans for coding tasks takes time and often results in missed steps. This skill transforms any coding request into a clear, actionable plan with scope boundaries, ordered checklist items, and identified open questions.
actual_capabilities: Scans project context (README, docs) to understand constraints
Creates scoped plans with explicit in/out boundaries
Operates in read-only mode during planning
Uses multiple-choice questions when clarification is needed
limitations: Does not write or modify any files
Does not execute code or run commands
Limited to planning - no implementation or deployment

use_cases.title: Break down feature requests
use_cases.description: Transforms feature requests into ordered implementation steps with test and rollout considerations.

use_cases.title: Estimate work scope
use_cases.description: Creates clear scope boundaries and identifies unknowns before committing to project timelines.

use_cases.title: Review implementation approaches
use_cases.description: Provides structured review of technical approaches with edge cases and validation checkpoints.

prompt_templates.title: Basic plan request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plan for [describe your task] in [project name]. Focus on [specific area].

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a refactoring plan for [file/module]. Goal: [improve performance/readability/test coverage].

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Investigate and create a fix plan for [bug description]. Error: [paste error message].

prompt_templates.title: Complex migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a migration plan from [current tech] to [new tech] for [scope]. Include rollback strategy.

output_examples.input: Create a plan to add user authentication to our API
output: Plan intent: Implement secure authentication for API endpoints
Scope in: Auth routes, middleware, user model
Scope out: OAuth integration, password reset
Action items: Add User model, Create auth routes, Implement middleware, Add tests, Update docs

output_examples.input: Create a refactoring plan for the legacy payment module
output: Goal: Improve maintainability and test coverage
Scope in: Core payment logic, unit tests
Scope out: API changes, UI components
Action items: Analyze current structure, Extract interfaces, Add tests, Modernize syntax, Verify all tests pass

output_examples.input: Create a migration plan from Express to FastAPI
output: Intent: Modernize API framework for better performance
Scope in: Route handlers, middleware, configuration
Scope out: Database schema changes, client applications
Action items: Set up FastAPI project, Migrate routes one-by-one, Add async support, Test endpoints, Update deployment

best_practices: Provide project context like README and architecture docs for better plans
Ask clarifying questions early if requirements are unclear
Review scope boundaries before starting implementation
anti_patterns: Asking for plans without providing project context
Requesting plans for vague or ambiguous tasks
Skipping the scope section and creating unbounded plans

faq.question: Does this skill modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. This skill operates strictly in read-only mode. It only reads project files for context.

faq.question: How detailed are the generated plans?
faq.answer: Plans include 6-10 action items with file paths and validation steps. Each item is atomic and ordered.

faq.question: Can I use this with any programming language?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill is language-agnostic and works with any codebase structure.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. No data is transmitted externally. All context scanning happens locally.

faq.question: Why does it ask follow-up questions?
faq.answer: It asks at most 1-2 questions only when absolutely necessary to create a responsible plan.

faq.question: How is this different from asking Claude directly?
faq.answer: This skill enforces a consistent structure with scope boundaries, ordered checklists, and explicit out-of-scope items.
